name: Galeria Plaza

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having stayed at the Calinda Geneve Zona Rosa during the first leg of our Mexican trip, we decided to try a nicer and quieter hotel while still staying in the Zona Rosa area. The Galeria Plaza proved to be a fantastic choice. The people who work there where all very friendly and catered to our needs. The rooms were nicely appointed and very comfortable. The pool and gym facilities located on the top level were not espectacular but adequate and provided a place to relax and catch some rays. The hotel is within walking distance to many shops, restaurants and night clubs and to all forms of public transportation which will take you just about anywhere you want to go within the city. I have stayed at many different hotels in Mexico City and this one will definitely get my business in all my future trips there.
reviews.title: Great Hotel - Great location

reviews.title: Great Location-Friendly Staff
reviews.text: Stayed recently at the Galeria Plaza for the first time and I was very satisfied with the staff and the location, it's within walking distance of the famed "zona rosa" in Mexico City an area filled with restaurants, nightclubs and excellent shopping. I will be coming back to Mexico City in the coming months and I will be staying at the Galeria Plaza once again.

reviews.title: A Great Experience at a Great Location!
reviews.text: This hotel was a great choice for our stay in Mexico City. Its location allowed us to walk throughout the shops and restaurants in the Zona Rosa with our teenaged daughters. The rooms were spacious and the maid service was excellent.

reviews.title: Very good
reviews.text: The Galeria Plaza was also within walking distance of the museums and Chapultepec Park. We enjoyed a Sunday in the park where we saw maybe one other "tourist family" and absolutely no beggars. The park was filled with Mexican families enjoying the weather and the surroundings.

reviews.title: great Place to stay in
reviews.text: The Galeria Plaza concierge service was helpful in arranging transportation to and from the airport, setting up a tour guide to take us to Frida Kahlo's house, recommending restaurants, and generally answering questions. Some conciege staff members really understood English; others were more surface in their understanding.

This is one of the best hotels ive ever stayed it. Great location despite the fact that its in the la zona rosa ( pink/gay zone), Great service - room service, restaurant, housekepping - everything. you could leave your clothes on the floor ( we tried it to check) and it would be folded up,and set onto the table and evveryything would be in military position every morning. The tea could be hidden in the bathroom and marked and we would see new set on the table unmarked. We couldnt believe they were that good.

I just returned from a 4 night stay at the Galeria Plaza in Zona Rosa. I have to disagree with the previous reviews of the hotel being "80's." We found the hotel very stylish and pretty. The staff was so helpful and nice, and most spoke English. The room was big and comfortable. The maids were great and we came back each day to a lovely clean room stocked with toiletries and water bottles. The area the hotel is in is very safe. There are police everywhere and the hotel staff looked out for our safety as well. We got a great bargain on the room and loved the location. I would highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Nice, affordable hotel

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed for three days and enjoyed it very much. Recieved a free upgrade to a master suite upon check-in. Large hotel with many outlets. Service was excellent but the food was average. Most spoke English also. Great location with many bars and eateries close by. The laundry prices are ridiculous though. It is around 6 US dollars to get one pair of underwear cleaned.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel
What a Wonderful Stay!
reviews.text: Don't be fooled by the somewhat dated and plain exterior of this hotel. The Galeria Plaza is an outstanding hotel in every way. My partner and I stayed there for four nights, and we couldn't have been more pleased. The best quality of this hotel was the service. All of the staff were extremely helpful and eager to please. In particular, I can't say enough about the maid service. Everyday our room was cleaned to the tee; we even got cookies one day! Our room was delightful. Though our view of Mexico City wasn't stellar, it did not matter because we thoroughly enjoyed our room amenities (what a comfy bed!) and slick modern dark wood decor. The rooftop pool looked great but it was too cool outside to go swimming (Keep in mind that Mexico City is in the mountains.) The rooftop gym was quite adequate and had a beautiful view of the city. The hotel is in a great location - The Zona Rosa. This area has many great shops and restaurants, and the Metro is just a few blocks away. Lastly, the price is right. Check around on the internet. We stay for about $100 US dollars a night - quite reasonable for the outstanding quality of this hotel. Stay at the Galeria Plaza; you won't be disappointed.
